Key Match Events: Canada advanced to the semi-final against Argentina by beating Venezuela 4-3 on penalty kicks after a 1-1 draw in the quarter-finals on July 5.
Pre-Game Insights: Canada is considered one of the best soccer countries in the world right now, alongside historic heavyweights like France, England, Netherlands, Spain, Argentina, Uruguay, and Colombia.
The current World Cup champions, Argentina, have adopted a similar risk-avoidant, star-negating style of play as Canada.
Canada's strategy involves collapsing back onto their own net like a 20-legged armadillo at the first hint of danger, similar to England's 'barricade ball' approach.
